medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain began acutely at approximately 5:00 pm. The pain was crampy, centered in the umbilicus, and transitioned to the right side over the following hours. Pain became worse and was accompanied by nausea and multiple episodes of non-bilious, non-bloody emesis. Patient also experienced chills but no fevers, as well as anorexia overnight. Denies changes in bowel or urinary habits, sick contacts, unusual foods, or recent travel.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, L5 pain and headaches (thought to be due to arachnoiditis and an L5 root lesion), back pain following epidural placement for C-Section, C-Section, removal of RP teratoma, wisdom tooth removal.
